citation.article-title: Proposal of a new halobacterial genus Natrinema gen. nov., with two species Natrinema pellirubrum nom. nov. and Natrinema pallidum nom. nov.

p.s: Description of Natrinema gen. nov.
Natrinema gen. nov. (Na.tri.ne'ma. L. n. natrium sodium; Gr. n. nema a thread; M.L. n. Natrinema the sodium thread, referring to the high sodium ion requirement, and the cell shape)
Cells rod-shaped 1-5 μm by 0.6-1.0 μm, but pleomorphic in unfavourable conditions.
Cells lyse in less than 1.5 M NaCl.
Colonies light orange-red or pale orange, 1-2 mm in diameter, smooth, circular, convex.
Gram-negative.
Chemo-organotrophs.
Strict aerobes.
Nitrogen sources: Casamino acids.
Carbon sources: Casamino acids and certain sugars.
Require at least 1.7 M NaCl for growth, optimum 3-4-4.3 M NaCl.
Optimum pH 7.0-76.
Some strains grow slowly at pH 8.6.
Gelatin liquefied, starch not hydrolysed, sulphide and indole not produced.
Possesses menaquinones MK-8 and MK-8(H2) (Collins et al., 1981) and both C20C20 and C20C25 diether core lipids (Ross et al., 1985; Ross & Grant, 1985).
Possesses several unidentified glycolipids (Ross et al., 1985).
Sensitive to anisomycin, bacitracin, novobiocin, vibriostatic agent (0/129) and sulphamethoxazole/trimetlioprim.
G + C content of major DNA component is 69.9 mol% and 60.0 mol% for the minor component (Ross & Grant, 1985).
Possesses a large plasmid of approximately 144 kbp (Ross & Grant, 1985).
Type species: Natrinema pellirubrum nom. nov.
